job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Mobile, AL
pros: The best part about the acute care setting is seeing and feeling that you are making a difference. You actually get to witness your patients get better. I would also have to commend the comradery compared to other places. The majority of the nurses there get along well and work together.
cons: The pay isn't worth the work, you're constantly working short handed. The lack of knowledge about the scope of practice of what you can and cannot do. Started as a care tech transitioned to nurse, the tech side was easier for sure.

review_title: Excellent, friendly, clean environment. Would give 5 stars except for lowest salary among hospitals in the area.
pros: Great work environment, very tech friendly, physicians are accessible, CNAs are well trained, Case Management an excellent resource - readily available - Patient safety & employee satisfaction appear to matter more than at some other local hospitals. Will pay for ACLS & PALS for new grads.
cons: Starting hourly rate below average @ $19.19 and raises are annually evaluated in early fall. Many floors require BSN - I would suggest starting elsewhere and then getting hired here - even with 6 months of experience you can start at $1 more

pros: Beautiful city with nearby beaches.  Mild winters and lots to see and do outdoors and in, year round.  Low cost of living and beautiful places to live.
cons: You're pretty much stuck in whatever department you hire into, especially if you work at night.  PRN and travel nurses seem very happy. Fulltime staff happiness varies.  Hospital policy for transfer and management will tell you they support transfers within hospital departments.  But if your good at your job they stonewall you.

pros: Great work invironment. Family oriented. Good training. Never turned loose until well trained. Coworkers helpful and friendly. Commitment to patients come first. Professional care. Also supervisors will work with you on. Your schedule. Great sick  time benefits.
cons: Parking for employees a little distance away. Well I don't know cant really think of anything negative. I really loved my job, just got past retirement age, so decided to retire.

review_title: The 7 months I worked at this hospital was a good learning experience for me
